required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Auriculotherapy Effectiveness on Stress and Anxiety in Nursing Student
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of the Auriculotherapy on Reducing Stress and Anxiety in Nursing Student: Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Single-blind randomized controlled trial aimed to assess stress and anxiety levels in Nursing School students of Beneficence Portuguese Hospital and review the effectiveness of true and placebo auriculotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Although researches on stress have a strong focus on stress at work,it is very important the evaluation of the stress and its consequences in Nursing students. This allows to understand which stress factors experienced in a negative way could interfere on the adaptive success in school activities. Students can experience symptoms of the alarm phase of stress such as tachycardia, muscle tension, skin and cold extremities, and also the second phase of stress such as headache, sleepiness, irritability and difficulty concentrating. High levels of stress have a substantial effect on attention and can lead to errors, lack of concentration and fluctuations in the level of attention. The auriculotherapy may have an important role as a coping strategy for stress and anxiety. It is a fast, relatively simple, easily performed, safe and without major side effects.

primary_outcome.description: The List of Symptoms of Stress is an evaluation questionnaire which consists of a list of 59 psycho-physiological and psychosocial stress, in which the subject must associate to each symptom of the four answers: never (0), rarely (1 ), often (2) or always (3). The scores are added together and the answers provide the level of stress the individual.In this questionnaire to score from 0 to 11 is void, 12 to 29 (low level), 30 to 59 (medium level), 60 to 120 (high level) and 120 to 177, very high level. Participants below 29 points were excluded.

secondary_outcome.description: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory consists of 2 scales, each one containing 20 items. One of the scales evaluates state anxiety, characterized by subjective feelings of tension and apprehension, followed by autonomic nervous system responses at a given moment. Trait anxiety, assessed by the other scale, refers to a relatively stable tendency to perceive situations at threatening and react anxiously to them. The scores are divided into low, moderate, high and very high and are determined by the sum of 20 symptoms from a 5-point Likert-type scale.The range of scores is 20-80, the higher the score indicating greater anxiety for both the Trait and State Anxiety.

arm_group.description: The chinese auriculotherapy is a intervention used by Chinese Traditional Medicine in order to balance the body energy and to treat several kind of diseases using semi-permanent needles in specific points of the auricular pavilion. Two points were chosen to treat stress and anxiety (Shenmen and Brainstem).
Auriculotherapy by sham, at the fist and outer ear points. These points aren't indicated for stress and anxiety.
Control Group didn't receive any treatment and was evaluated at the same time and the same way of interventions group

intervention.description: Auriculotherapy stimulates points to achieve better emotional balance, mental and physiological.
They were evaluated at the baseline,twelve sessions and 15-day follow-up and received 12 sessions through the Fist and Outer ear points.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Average and high score by the List of Stress Symptoms
- Voluntary participation in the study
- Availability of time for submission to the sessions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Medical license or vacation during the period
- Low score of stress

facility.name: Real e Benemérita Associação Portuguesa de Beneficência

results_reference.citation: Giaponesi ANL, Leão ER. Auriculotherapy as an intervention to reduce stress reduction among the nursing team in intensive care. Nursing (São Paulo);12(139):575-579, dez. 2009. ilus.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The recruitment of students was conducted between January and July 2011 at the Nursing School of Portuguese Beneficence Hospital. Eighty five people were invited and seventy one subjects were enrolled and randomized into 3 groups.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: No sample size calculation was done for this study because the number of the population was small and it was decided to invite all students to attend nursing school test.

Two points were chosen to treat stress and anxiety (Shenmen and Brainstem). Auriculotherapy : Auriculotherapy stimulates points to achieve better emotional balance, mental and physiological.

outcome.description: The List of Symptoms of Stress is an evaluation questionnaire which consists of a list of 59 psycho-physiological and psychosocial stress, in which the subject must associate to each symptom of the four answers: never (0), rarely (1 ), often (2) or always (3). The scores are added together and the answers provide the level of stress the individual.In this questionnaire to score from 0 to 11 is void, 12 to 29 (low level), 30 to 59 (medium level), 60 to 120 (high level) and 120 to 177, very high level. Participants below 29 points were excluded.
outcome.population: It was analysed only the subjects that ended the study.

measure.title: Students Stress Levels
measure.description: The List of Symptoms of Stress is an evaluation questionnaire which consists of a list of 59 psycho-physiological and psychosocial stress, in which the subject must associate to each symptom of the four answers: never (0), rarely (1 ), often (2) or always (3). The scores are added together and the answers provide the level of stress the individual.In this questionnaire to score from 0 to 11 is void, 12 to 29 (low level), 30 to 59 (medium level), 60 to 120 (high level) and 120 to 177, very high level. Participants below 29 points were excluded.
measure.population: It was analysed only the subjects that ended the study.

analysis.groups_desc: It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA) among the groups at the 3rd (12 sessions) Hypothesis: there is at least one difference among the groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: It was used the Post Hoc and the statistical significance was p<0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: It was verified the normality of data distribution and the homogeneity of variance. It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA) among the groups at the follow-up (after 15 days).

outcome.title: Students Anxiety Levels
outcome.description: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory consists of 2 scales, each one containing 20 items. One of the scales evaluates state anxiety, characterized by subjective feelings of tension and apprehension, followed by autonomic nervous system responses at a given moment. Trait anxiety, assessed by the other scale, refers to a relatively stable tendency to perceive situations at threatening and react anxiously to them. The scores are divided into low, moderate, high and very high and are determined by the sum of 20 symptoms from a 5-point Likert-type scale.The range of scores is 20-80, the higher the score indicating greater anxiety for both the Trait and State Anxiety.
outcome.population: It was analysed only the number of participants that ended the study.

group.title: Auriculotherapy Group
group.description: The chinese auriculotherapy is a intervention used by Chinese Traditional Medicine in order to balance the body energy and to treat several kind of diseases using semi-permanent needles in specific points of the auricular pavilion. Two points were chosen to treat stress and anxiety (Shenmen and Brainstem). Auriculotherapy : Auriculotherapy stimulates points to achieve better emotional balance, mental and physiological.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Control Group didn't receive any treatment and was evaluated at the same time and the same way of interventions group

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Auriculotherapy by sham, at the fist and outer ear points. These points aren't indicated for stress and anxiety.

measure.title: Students Anxiety Levels
measure.description: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory consists of 2 scales, each one containing 20 items. One of the scales evaluates state anxiety, characterized by subjective feelings of tension and apprehension, followed by autonomic nervous system responses at a given moment. Trait anxiety, assessed by the other scale, refers to a relatively stable tendency to perceive situations at threatening and react anxiously to them. The scores are divided into low, moderate, high and very high and are determined by the sum of 20 symptoms from a 5-point Likert-type scale.The range of scores is 20-80, the higher the score indicating greater anxiety for both the Trait and State Anxiety.
measure.population: It was analysed only the number of participants that ended the study.

analysis.groups_desc: It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA)of the medium difference among the groups in the 3rd (12 sessions) Hypothesis: there is at least one difference among the groups (State Anxiety)
analysis.p_value_desc: After ANOVA it was performed Post Hoc Test and the statistical significance was p<0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: It was carried out the analysis of variance (ANOVA) of the medium difference among the groups at the follow-up (after 15 days). Hypothesis: there is at least one difference among the groups (State Anxiety).
analysis.p_value_desc: After ANOVA, the Post Hoc Test was done and the statistical significance was p<0.05.

reported_events.desc: Tenderness and pain at the auricular point after the treatment

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The limitation of the trial was the reduced number of the sample.
